text:
Hey all - I'm experimenting with the beta api for marketing emails. I'm trying to fetch email name from latest source drill down 2. It returns an email ID. When I search for email details using that ID, I get a 404 - some work some don't. Has anyone had a similar experience?

/marketing/v3/emails/{emailId}
Ok, latest_source_drill_down_2 is returning an internal HubSpot ID NOT the email id. Hence the break.

Hi everyone,

I hope you are doing well. We need assistance with an issue that has come up after we transitioned from using Hapikey (v2 version) to a Private App (v3 version) for our API calls. Since this change, we've had trouble tracking Google and Facebook leads in our HubSpot contacts list.

Previously, using [specific code], tracking for Google contacts worked correctly with the v2 version. However, after switching to the v3 version, the tracking no longer differentiates properly between Google and Facebook leads. Instead, [specific code] seems to aggregate contacts from both sources under a single filter in the HubSpot contacts list, specifically under the "Original source drill-down 2" filter option.

Could you help us resolve this issue so that we can correctly track and differentiate leads coming from Google and Facebook separately, as we did before?

Your prompt attention to this matter would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your help and support.

We're working on implementing the new <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/apps/extensions/calling-extensions/recordings-and-transcriptions|Call Recording API>. We've been able to successfully setup the new endpoint to return the audio urls and have been able to successfully send in new call records. However we are having issues when trying to play the audio.

Clicking "Review Recording" does open the modal and play the audio, but clicking the play button in the UI does not. If I click the external audio link I am presented with the following error:
```URL: <https://api-na1.HubSpot.com/recording/auth/provider/hublets/v1/external-url-retriever/getAuthRecording/portal/7810084/engagement/58661954614>

ERROR:
{"status":"error","message":"internal error","correlationId":"770f8dc8-dca7-48c2-a85f-f15d9b0eed3b"}```
Here is a recording on the issue in action: <https://www.loom.com/share/5430672968504753b0a84e699bed4b32>

Any idea what could be causing this?
does anyone know how to get the password for Sequence API? :eyes: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/sequences>

<@U05E77XEY4V> Hi! So the primary benefit is for our Portal Migration app. (It would also benefit the native sandboxing tool.) Essentially the ability to view/create/edit sequences via API would allow us to migrate them from staging/dev/prod to another portal. Also it would unlock alot of robust functionality for app developers that focus on sales enablement to deploy sequences to HubSpot portals as part of their apps.
Same argument that I made for the automation/workflows API. Its just I suppose more niched to sales hub.

Hi <@U07DPM31V1N>,

No problem at all, I hope you enjoyed your leave! Yes, I'm still encountering the same issue.
